intro: Ptilotus incanus, commonly known as the silverleaf ptilotus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Ptilotus incanus is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
